Sign the petition to stop federal executions.
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation## –

The majority of people in this country support an alternative over the death penalty, and want a fair and just criminal justice system. But the Trump administration feels differently, deciding earlier this year to restart federal executions.

Immediately after making this decision, the Justice Department scheduled an alarming string of back to back executions without even giving time for the courts to review problems with the cases and execution protocols. A court-ordered injunction has put those executions on hold for now, but we still haven't won this fight. It's up to us to raise our voices and demand our government uphold the will of the people.

Sign the petition to Attorney General Barr to halt his plan to restart executions.

The U.S. is in the minority of countries in the world that still practice capital punishment. Even within our own country, capital punishment has been losing public support for decades. That's because our system is deeply flawed, inhumane, and unequal – people of color are sentenced to death at disproportionate rates, and the severity of these sentences often correlate with the race of the victims.

What's more, since 1973, 166 people have been exonerated after being wrongfully convicted and sentenced to death. That's a risk we can't afford to take.

##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##, if you are one of the millions of people in this country who oppose the death penalty, then now is the time to speak up. Add your name to join our fight against the death penalty.

If enough of us come together, we can show the federal government that it has no choice but to halt these executions.

Thanks for joining our fight,

Cassandra Stubbs
Director of the ACLU Capital Punishment Project
